page.title: 11Finedon's Post Lady
page.content: At half past five in the morning the post-lady gets up,she has to be at the Post Office by 6.15am. There are five other people working at the Post Office. At 6.30am she begins sorting the mail and delivering the parcels at about 7.30am.It may be 30 to 40 parcels a day. She travels about 10 miles a day but can use a bike, sometimes she uses her car. She delivers to all parts of Finedon and finishes at about 10.30am. She likes being a post-lady because when she gets up she enjoys the weather and the birds singing. She has to work six days a week, having Sundays off and four weeks holiday a year, plus the Bank Holidays. In her spare time she does knitting, sewing tatting and reading.
